content: A single-threaded concurrency model â€” one core runs a loop that dispatches callbacks when I/O operations complete, avoiding mutex contention entirely. JavaScript (Node.js, browsers), Python asyncio, and Rust's tokio all use this pattern. Non-blocking I/O calls (epoll, kqueue, IOCP) register interest, and the loop multiplexes thousands of concurrent connections without spawning threads. Ideal for I/O-bound workloads; CPU-bound tasks block the loop and must be offloaded.
